intro: Centaurea amblyolepis, commonly known as the narrowleaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branched stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its small blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, and the plant is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
